name: General Knowledge 11 Quiz / Test | Mixed 25 Questions | 25 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of the flag flown by pirates?
questions.explanation:
Jolly Roger.

	The traditional pirate flag consists of a white skull and crossbones on a black field.

questions.text: Which is the largest state in the USA by area?
questions.explanation:
Alaska.

	Although by far the largest US state, it has the second smallest population after Vermont.

questions.text: Which famous British naval commander was killed in 1805?
There are two principal braking systems used in cars. One uses disc brakes and the other uses ... ?
Which two metals combine to make bronze?
Which aircraft is also known as the 'Jumbo Jet'. The Boeing ....?
Who was the first wife of Henry VIII of England?
Which Shakespearean character says, 'To be, or not to be: that is the question'?
Marie Antoinette was the wife of which King of France?
Which is NOT a character from the cartoon series 'Scooby-Doo, Where are You'?
questions.explanation:
Thelma.

	It was Velma not Thelma. The programme took its title from a line in the Frank Sinatra song 'Strangers in the Night' ('scooby-dooby-doo'). Scooby-Doo was a cowardly Great Dane who roamed the countryside with a gang of teenage detectives in their Mystery Machine van.

questions.text: Who is the winged goddess of victory in Greek Mythology?
Who invented the mercury thermometer?
In the children's television programme 'The Wacky Races' which statement is incorrect?
questions.correct: The Ant Hill Mob drove the 'Roaring Forties'
questions.explanation:
The Ant Hill Mob drove the 'Roaring Forties'.

	The Ant Hill Mob drove the 'Roaring Plenty'

questions.text: Who was the creator of 'Billy Bunter' of Greyfriars School?
questions.explanation:
Frank Richards.

	Richmal Crompton created William as in 'Just William' (1922). Ronald Searle was associated with St Trinian adventures. Thomas Hughes was the author of Tom Brown's Schooldays (1857).

questions.text: Who lives at the ramshackle mansion at 000 North Cemetery Ridge?
questions.explanation:
The Addams Family.

	The Munsters live at 1313 Mockingbird Lane.

questions.text: Name the 1986 book by Stephen King. Skeleton ....?
Which cartoon comedy by William Hanna and Joseph Barbera was dubbed an 'inked disaster' by the New York Times as a review of its opening episodes?
Who directed '102 Dalmatians'. Kevin ...?
Who has a middle name of 'Henrietta'?
In what Sci-fi programme do we meet 'Knight Industries Two Thousand'?
questions.explanation:
Knight Rider.

	Rebuilt ex-policeman Michael Knight and his talking automobile 'KITT' (Knight Industries Two Thousand), a 300 m.p.h. black Pontiac Trans Am.

questions.text: In which Agatha Christie novel did Hercule Poirot first appear?
'The Flintstones' is set in the city of Bedrock in which county?
questions.explanation:
Cobblestone County.

	The Flintstones were originally to be called 'The Flagstones'.

questions.text: Which British comedian's real given names were Alfred Hawthorne?
In Disney's 'Sleeping Beauty', what was the name of the horse Prince Phillip rode?
questions.explanation:
Samson.

	Special thanks to my eight year old daughter, Bethany, for supplying this question.

questions.text: The 'King Hassan Mosque' is one the biggest mosques in the world, holding 100,000 worshipers and has a laser beam on the top of its 176 metre high minaret that can be seen 50 kilometres away. Where is it located?
questions.explanation:
Casablanca.

	Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
